clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study Phase III, Randomized, Double-blind, Prospective and Comparative to Evaluate the Efficacy and Tolerability of Using APETIVITON BC Compared to Petivit BC in Appetite Stimulate.
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study Phase III, Randomized, Double-blind, Prospective and Comparative to Evaluate the Efficacy and Tolerability of Using APETIVITON BC Compared to Petivit BC in Appetite Stimulate.

brief_summary.textblock: Clinical study phase III, randomized, double-blind, prospective, comparative non-inferiority to evaluate the efficacy and tolerability of using APETIVITON BC compared to Petivit BC in appetite stimulate in children, adults and elderly.

detailed_description.textblock:
Clinical trial phase III, randomized, double-blind, prospective, comparative non-inferiority to evaluate the efficacy and tolerability of using APETIVITON BC compared to Petivit BC stimulation of appetite in children, adults and elderly. A total of 150 patients, distributed as follows:
25 patients treated children Apetiviton BC,25 patients treated children Petivit BC, (2-6 years).
25 adult patients treated with Apetiviton BC,25 adult patients treated with Petivit BC, (18-50 years.
25 elderly patients treated with Apetiviton BC,25 elderly patients treated with Petivit BC. (60-80 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the effectiveness of apetiviton BC compared to Petivit BC in appetite stimulation in children, adults and seniors.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the tolerability of apetiviton BC compared to Petivit BC the stimulation of appetite in children, adults and seniors

intervention.description: Administer the recommended dosage preferably one hour before the main meal: Children (2 to 6 years): 2.5 mL 3 x daily. Adults (18 to 50 years): 5 mL 3 x daily. Elderly (60 to 80 years): 5 ml 3 x daily.
